snippet: Thousands of Ukrainian soldiers and sailors have been trapped on bases and other installations for more than two weeks, surrounded by heavily armed Russian forces and local militia.
abstract: Ukrainian government, bowing to reality of Russian military occupation of Crimea, says it plans to evacuate all of its military personnel and their families and is prepared to relocate as many as 25,000 of them to mainland Ukraine.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and ANDREW E. KRAMER
byline.contributor: David M. Herszenhorn reported from Sevastopol, and Andrew E. Kramer from Kiev, Ukraine. Reporting was contributed by Mark Landler from Vilnius, Lithuania; Alison Smale from Berlin; Rick Gladstone from New York; Somini Sengupta from the United Nations; Alan Cowell from London; Noah Sneider from Sevastopol; and Patrick Reevell from Simferopol, Crimea.

lead_paragraph: Thousands of Ukrainian soldiers and sailors have been trapped on bases and other installations for more than two weeks, surrounded by heavily armed Russian forces and local militia.

headline.main: Ukraine Plans to Withdraw Troops From Russia-Occupied Crimea
headline.print_headline: Ukraine Plans to Withdraw Troops From Russia-Occupied Crimea
